subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to create data-driven tests?
msgSnippet: Vibha, Also have a look at MockObjects (www.mockobjects.org) also. We are using MockObjects for mocking database. It helps if you are testing your service and
messageBody:
Vibha,

Also have a look at MockObjects (www.mockobjects.org) also. We are using
MockObjects for mocking database. It helps if you are testing your service
and utility class and saves a lot of time in accessing dataBase.

Shailesh
-----Original Message-----
From: vibha_malhotra16_2 [mailto:vibha_malhotra16_2@...]
Sent: Monday, May 13, 2002 11:26 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: How to create data-driven tests?


Hi,

I am sorry Christian, I misspelled your name in the previous
mail. Thanks a lot once again for the reply.

It will be really helpful though, if I can access some code
examples for implementation through dbunit.

I have just one more query. Are jTestCase and JXUnit also used
for a similar functionality?

Thanks in advance,

Vibha
